Authors: Zhanen Yang, Haixia Ma, Changlin Zhao
Title:
Morphological characters and phylogenetic analyses reveal a
new species of Hypoxylon from southern China
Keywords:
Ascomycota, Taxonomy, Sordariomycetes, Phylogenetic
analyses, Yunnan Province
Abstract:
A new species, Hypoxylon puerense, is proposed based on
morphological and molecular characters. The species is characterized by
its, applanate stromata with fulvous to rust color, perithecia,
subglobose to obovoid, asci without apical apparatus, not bluing in
MelzerÂ’s iodine reagent, perispore dehiscent in 10% KOH, with conspicuous
coil-like ornamentation. The differences between the new species and
some morphologically similar Hypoxylon species are discussed.
Phylogenetic analyses of ITS gene region demonstrated that H. puerense
formed a single lineage and was sister to H. ticinense with strong
statistical supports (100% BS, 100% BT, 1.00 BPP).
